The Chancellor of the Exchequer informed the Cabinet ofthe terms of the public statement, which he had mentioned to them onthe preceding day, announcing increases in the rates of interestcharged on loans made by the Public Works Loan Board and the initiation of negotiations for new housing subsidies.The Cabinet-. Authorised the Chancellor of the Exchequer to make this announcement in the terms proposed.Demise of theCrown.The King'sFuneral.(previous reference:C.C. (52) 13thConclusions,Minute 1.)3. The Foreign Secretary said that two of the scandinavian countries, of whose Fleets the late King had been an Admiral, wouldlike to send naval contingents to the Funeral. It would not, however,be in accordance with precedent to invite any foreign Powers to sendcontingents from their armed forces to the Funeral; and, if any foreign countries sent Service contingents, many others would wishto be similarly represented but would not find it practicable to arrangethis in the time available. It seemed desirable therefore to followprecedent on this point.The Cabinet Invited the Foreign Secretary to advise the Earl Marshalthat no Service contingents from foreign countries shouldtake part in the Funeral ceremonies of His late Majesty.Steel Prices. 4. The Cabinet had some preliminary discussion on theproposal to increase steel prices in this country, and on the possibilityof increasing the prices charged for steel exported from this country.The Cabinet agreed to resume discussion of both these questions at a meeting in the following week.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,8th February, 1952.
